alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 7:55AM AKST until January 29 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Falls Creek near Areas Around Falls Creek. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 753 AM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in areas around Falls Creek. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially near Falls Creek. Between 0.4 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.6 to 0.9 inches are possible. - Fall Creek is expected to crest later today between 23.5 and 24.0 feet. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 7:00am the stage was 22.45 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet. Impacts: At 24.0 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
